content.label: It is one of the most creative games I've played
Fresh take on a rhythm game.  Love it
All I get is the developer logo, then it drops right back to the desktop.
I love this game because it's so cool how the game works and I love the beats in it. Good Job Simogo!

The music is hip, the gameplay is fresh, and the two are excellently integrated. Play it now. 

That said, Simogo, I would like to see some iCloud integration for saved games.
This game is definitely worth the money. It's a perfect balance of rhythm and puzzle and has a really cool art style. I LOVE the shadow levels!!
if you are unsure whether to buy this or not, BUY! its so fun and different and perfect!
The most amazing game i've played in the I-pad

I love this game! What got my attention was the art style, it's so cute. It took me awhile to get the hang of it but once I did I was hooked. The music is fun and I enjoy solving the puzzle of getting to all the clocks before finishing the levels. This game is simple and really well made. I would definitely recommend it.

This is my favorite game on my phone. I even put it on my iPad as well so that I could use it as a reward in my music classroom. Seriously, this is fun and just tricky enough that you keep playing without getting frustrated.
But the playability drove me nuts.  After playing 4 or 5 levels, I'll probably not play again.
Can't wait for the map pack updates.
At first I thought I spent too much on a random game. Second level in... I'm hooked.
The best iOS game i've ever played.
Super fun and lovely visuals.
This is the best iOS game I've played in a long time. Definitely a must-buy!üëç
Tons of fun! I'd give it a 5-star review, but would love to see iCloud integration to sync game progress across devices. Installed it on my iPad as well, then realized I'd have to start all over...
Take the time (no pun intended) to look at the amazing artwork.

Love this game. Entertaining and it challenges your brain a little bit, but not to the point where you get frustrated and want to throw your phone. Great use for kids learning rhythm as well, they will learn to tap in beat.

I liked this game a lot, until I got to the clocks worth final challenge. since the game I believe is directed to kids learning rhythm many of the levels are very easy.  Although I would have enjoyed a challenge more I let it slide becuase the game is fun.  the clocks worth would have been perfect because it is the hardest of the levels but I was wrong.  It is extremely hard and I can't imagine a kid passing it without getting frustrated many times before.  don't change the last level but in the future make it easier.

This is a fun and addictive game. It has a simple concept which takes you back to the Nolan Bushnell Atari days of pick up and play...no need for a manual. The puzzles are challenging enough to keep you engaged. The music and graphics are excellent too. I'll be looking forward to more great games from Simogo. GREAT JOB!!!

title.label: Most brilliant iOS game I've ever seen.

content.label:
To the critics: Really?

To people wondering if they should buy the game: Do! If you like puzzle games (and I do), then this is THE game for you. It's so innovative while retaining simplicity‚Äîthe epitome of genius in game design. At first I was a little annoyed by the game's one button, but it's so obvious now that this is the superior choice for this puzzle game. I've owned an iPod touch for a few years, along with some top-selling iOS games, and literally, this is the first iOS game I've ever played all the way through; I got bored with the others too quick‚Äîincluding number-one sellers! Even though I just beat this game, I'll probably start over again tomorrow. It definitely has replay value. I highly recommend it! (I even posted on FB about it, which I NEVER do.)

To the developers: Outstanding game! I was a little nervous about the $2.99 price, having only seen one video and the GDC prize, but my impulse buy was well rewarded. You guys definitely deserve it. Huge congrats, and I look forward to seeing what you come up with in the future!
Best game I've bought since I got my iPhone
Beautiful, fun, amazing
Fun, challenging and addictive!

Not worth 3 bucks, in my opinion. Especially considering the breadth of quality games available for free or 99 cents occupying the Top 25 lists. Even if this game was 99 cents I'd feel I'd wasted my money. It's pretty lame.
Never spent 3$ on a video game before but I have to say I've never played such a good iPhone game like this in the past! Amazing, definitely worth more than this!
This game is great!

title.label: One of the most ingenious little games.

content.label:
I have to give a five star for a game with just ingenuity in its design, and a solid performer. This ranks up with Tiny Wings as the two most ingenious game designs that offer so much gameplay with only one finger touching the screen to pull it off. 

Level design is great. Also nice to see how the timing of traps and all not only work into broadening the things you can accomplish with the simple mechanic, but they actually feed into the background music. That means, getting into the groove is needed to truly make solving the puzzles feel like a breeze. You start to lock onto what trap, door, etc. is associated with what instrument it is in the song. 

Wouldn't mind seeing a sequel or more of this in the future.
Bad game, not worth wasting my iTunes gift certificate on.

name.label: H o r r o r I b l e

content.label: The music is terrible. They should use rap music.BOOM!
First game I actually play regularly on my iPhone. Very clever gameplay, great music, and something new. I hope the guy who made it is rich
I like this game at first but by level 3 it's almost impossible to get the clocks  this game is a RIPOFF .
one if not my favorite ios game ever

Fun game, interesting concept, love the music. I beat it, the boss level was clever. The game gets a little boring, though. Would be nice if there were different tempos (maybe even changing during the same level).

Also, stop asking me if I want to skip a level! Excuse me for not getting it in three tries, but it doesn't mean I want to give up!
This was ridiculously boring.. Hype is an understatement!! Apple's return policy on stupid apps is stupid!
Live the music, style, and gameplay!  I'm hooked!!!

I love the concept and the gameplay. 
I would give it five stars but it cost to much money. I suggest u guys bring the cost down to 0.99$
Game is pretty addictive great game.

The game manages to accomplish everything it sets out to do.  It's a sneaking game, combined with puzzles and rhythm.  Lots of fun, addictive, and the art and music are superb.  If this was on PS Vita it would cost 40 bucks.
Reminds me of how fun it was to play the PSP rhythm game Patapon. The art style blends perfectly with the music. The polish on the game is also very high. Even the menus move to the beat :)

It's pretty amazing that they've mashed up stealth, rhythm, and puzzle into a single game. And it's even more amazing that it actually works really well and is a lot of fun. It's simply one of the most creative games I've seen on iOS so far. The controls are very simple (it's a one-button-style game) but there's a good amount of depth in how you use the movement to your advantage while navigating the levels. The puzzles are great, and there are plenty of head-scratchers that will keep you guessing. I don't find this game frustrating at all, because the rules are very simple and the gameplay runs perfectly. Once you've got that down, it's pure puzzle solving, which requires timing, direction, and placement in a combination that's hard to find elsewhere. It's a beautifully crafted and designed experience. The sound, a vital component of the game, is also very well produced and engaging. This is an A+ title that everyone should try. Well worth the asking price. I'm looking forward to expansions/sequels already.
Really fun game. It used up most of my free time for several days. Only problem is that if you play it too much at night just before you go to bed you can hear the melody in your dreams.
Unskippable cut scenes, annoying game play decisions. Mostly spent waiting for menus and cutscene animations! Too much reading. And, un-fun gameplay.

I thought this was going to be neat. The graphics are well done and it's an interesting idea.

But the controls are completely incomprehensible; there is no clear way to turn around, not even swiping in the appropriate direction. The character just goes whichever direction it happens to be facing.

I really wish this had been a better experience.
Very funny, nice to play.

As a gamer who typically plays consoles, this game is a great value (a few bucks vs. $50+) and a creative change up that I adore and celebrate.  A top notch game only need this level of creativity and this well executed.  Worth every penny, possibly more.

title.label: Great, if not quite Spy Mouse great.

content.label: I love the concept and the graphics and music are very well done. I prefer the depth and variety of Spy Mouse for a vaguely similar type of timing-based movement puzzler, but this one is also great and worth having.

title.label: An interesting take on the rhythm genre!

content.label: The game combines taping to the beat of the music, with a puzzle and stealth element. The music is really good from level to level. The only downside is that when later on, when puzzles get harder, the game gets kinda frustrating. You know what to do to get all the clocks in a level, except you might get the rhythm wrong, or just mess up and have to do the level over again. But regardless game is really good!
Game of the week or not, you will enjoy this tasty adventure.
